intro: Habzelia oxyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved habzelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and are known to attract various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
